title: London/Westminster
name: Morpeth Arms
content: Victorian pub built on the site of the cells of Millbank Prison, briefly Britain's National Penitentiary before being downgraded to a holding facility for convicts sentenced to transportation to Australia.  The pub is said to be haunted by the ghosts of prisoners who didn't last long enough for the journey.  For the living, the pub is next to the bank of the Thames and very close to the Tate gallery.
